intro: Danguyodrypetes abbayesii, commonly known as the Abyssinian sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
